about.title: About
about.subtitle: Music Is Medicine is a heartfelt Canadian music initiative created by Robert Frances, CEO of PEAK Financial Group and members of the band N2O. Five original singles by N2O featuring Grammy-winning artist Alan Parsons, raising funds and awareness for brain cancer research.
about.paragraph1: After losing a close bandmate to brain cancer, Robert Frances turned that loss into purpose. Together with Alan Parsons, he launched Music Is Medicine to use the power of music to raise awareness, support research, and offer hope to families all over the world.
about.paragraph2: Brain tumours affect thousands of families every year. Through past benefit concerts and early support, Music Is Medicine has raised over
about.paragraph2Continue: for brain cancer research and programs.
about.paragraph3: Every stream, download, and share contributes to the mission, with net proceeds donated to the Brain Tumour Foundation of Canada, helping fund research, advocacy, and patient support.

bandStory.title: The N2O Story
bandStory.subtitle: A band of lifelong friends whose music became medicine — honoring loss, celebrating friendship, and creating hope through every note
bandStory.photoCaption: Lifelong friends, boundless passion, timeless music

story.paragraph1: N2O is more than a band — we're a brotherhood of lifelong friends and musicians bound by a deep passion for music, creativity, and the magic of the recording process. We've always believed we're #never2old to evolve, write new songs, and push our sound forward.
story.paragraph2: Our music reflects the energy and joy of being young at heart — a dynamic blend of rock, pop, and power ballads driven by raw emotion and authenticity. But behind every chord and lyric is a deeper story.
story.paragraph3: When we lost our dear friend and bandmate David Tondino, it changed us all. David wasn't just our drummer — he was the heartbeat of our collaboration, a constant source of creativity and friendship. His passing left a profound impact on each of us, reshaping not just our music, but our purpose.

mission.title: Music as Medicine
mission.paragraph1: From the beginning, our goal was to use our music to create a legacy — to tell the story of our journey, the creative process, and how we found a way forward after losing David. We wanted to honor his memory by continuing to make the music he loved.
mission.paragraph2: When Alan Parsons and his Live Project came to Montreal, something magical happened. Alan and his band recorded and produced stunning new versions of our original songs, bringing the band's vision for Music is Medicine to life in ways we never imagined.
mission.paragraph3: Now, being able to contribute our music to support brain cancer research at The Neuro feels like a full-circle moment. David's spirit lives on in every note, and through this initiative, we're transforming our grief into hope, our loss into healing, and our music into medicine.

tribute.title: For David
tribute.quote: David Tondino was the heartbeat of N2O — a brilliant drummer, creative force, and cherished friend. His passing left an immeasurable void, but his spirit continues to inspire every song we create. This project is our tribute to him, our way of ensuring that his legacy lives on through music that heals.
